snippet: Reid the mountebank apparently knew well howto set the sails of his own interest to whatever windproved most likely to turn them. He failed not toavail himself of King James's rage for the conversion of heretics, on wliich subject Fountainhall hasthis sarcastic memorandum:—" Reid the mountebank is received into the Popishchurch, and one of his blackamoors was persuadedto accept of baptism from the Popish priests, andto turn Christian Papist, which was a great trophy. He was christened James, after the King and Chancellor, aud the Apostle James !"—(._-._. p. 440.)
